title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MIAMI — On a night when the final score read 108-105 in favor of the Miami Heat, only one name truly mattered. Alonzo Mourning didn’t just beat the Washington Bullets; he authored a performance for the ages, a Herculean 50-point, 12-rebound masterpiece that carved its place in NBA lore.

From the opening tip, it was clear something special was brewing in the capital. Mourning was an unstoppable force, a study in controlled fury. He dominated the paint with a relentless combination of thunderous dunks, feathery jump hooks, and a will that simply could not be denied by the overmatched Bullets frontline. Each possession was a testament to his sheer dominance, as he methodically dismantled the defense.

Washington, to its credit, fought valiantly. Juwan Howard’s 24 points and Chris Webber’s 20 points and 14 rebounds kept the Bullets within striking distance throughout the tense contest. But every time Washington threatened to seize momentum, Miami went back to its well. The ball would find Mourning in the post, and the result was almost always a foregone conclusion—two more points on the scoreboard.

The game culminated in a breathless final minute. With the outcome hanging in the balance, it was Mourning who made the defining plays, sealing the victory not just with his historic scoring but with crucial defensive stops and rebounds. When the final horn sounded, the stat sheet was a monument to one man’s indomitable will. On this night, Alonzo Mourning wasn't just a player; he was the entire game.
